H0.text: An immune response is avoided by treating a cut to the skin with antiseptic first.

H1.text: A bacterial infection is avoided when a cut to the skin is treated with antiseptic first.

H2.text: Bruising of tissues is avoided when a cut to the skin is treated with antiseptic first.

H3.text: An allergic reaction is what a cut to the skin is treated with antiseptic first to avoid.

A4.text: Joseph Lister, in the 1860s, began treating his surgical gauze with carbolic acid, known today as phenol, and subsequently dropped his surgical team's mortality rate by 45%.

A5.text: The Ebers Papyrus, c. 1500 BCE, details the use of ... honey served as an antibiotic agent.
